plugin.name: InvisiMailScannner
plugin.description: Detects emails which contain no body content and no subject. This is a common indication of spam and/or denial of service messages

plugin.name: RobinsonScanner
plugin.description: Uses probability based intelligence together with a database of spam characteristics to analyze and detect spam

plugin.name: HTMLConcealmentScanner
plugin.description: Detects the presence of deliberately concealed information in an email. This is a technique often used by spammers to confuse anti-spam technology by adding high levels of noise into the message

plugin.name: ImageDominanceScanner
plugin.description: Detects unusal ratios of embedded images. A common feature of non-textual spam

plugin.name: TagSourceCgiScanner
plugin.description: Detects mail bugs. These are images or other embedded objects which transmit secret messages to remote servers when an email is opened

plugin.name: TagSourcePortScanner
plugin.description: Detects irregular URLs which reference unknown TCP ports. This is common in worm and/or trojan emails

plugin.name: TagFalseAnchorScanner
plugin.description: Detects emails which appear to falsly masquerade as a legitimate business such as a bank. Also known as phishing

plugin.name: ObfuscatedCharacterScanner
plugin.description: Detects obvious replacements of legitimate characters, such as @ in place of A. This often occurs in spam

plugin.name: AnomalousCharacterScanner
plugin.description: Detects excessive use of emphasis grammar such as exclamation marks, commonly found in spam

plugin.name: AttachmentScanner
plugin.description: Detects the presence of potentially dangerous email attachments which may indicate the presence of a worm, virus or trojan

plugin.name: RecipientScanner
plugin.description: Detects excessive numbers of email recipients which can often indicate a mass distribution spam

plugin.name: SenderAddressValidationScanner
plugin.description: Detects mail server fraud. This can occur when the sending mail server reports a fraudulent internet IP address or domain

plugin.name: FromAddressValidationScanner
plugin.description: Detects sender forgeries. This can occur when a sender fraudulently reports their email address as different to their real address

plugin.name: HeuristicScanner
plugin.description: Scans emails looking for known spam fingerprints. These are certain combinations of characteristics known to indicate spam

plugin.name: KeywordScanner
plugin.description: Performs a simple keyword scan of an email looking for known spam words and/or profanity

plugin.name: RBLScanner
plugin.description: Checks the delivery history of an email looking for black-listed mail servers. Also known as Realtime Blackhole Lists or RBLs
